author: siladu
content: on the subject of what should be

author: siladu
content:
Thanks for bringing this up on ACDT. I agree with <@1126229231572094976>'s comment https://forkcast.org/calls/acdt/067?chat=01:03:59
> Clients provided great rankings and cfi'd eips should j just be included in the order based on how much support they gained.

^ This feels fair to me and should eliminate any bias towards including smaller/larger EIPs. The testing impact can then inform when to stop adding.

Also like <@415548822983278593>'s comment to propose devnet scope a week in advance as for those of us not able to join the call, it gives some time to consider and object.

Also agree we should have at least a prototype implementation before SFIing but I don't think it necessarily needs to be included in devnet or have an impl from most clients. One prototype is usually enough to tease out most spec issues.

author: siladu
content:
Thanks to <@119818938845495298>'s https://forkcast.org/devnets/ sorted by "Avg Support":

If we rely on that, then we should consider including these EIPs in the next devnet as a priority:
EIP-7976 Increase Calldata Floor Cost
EIP-7981 Increase Access List Cost
EIP-2780 Reduce intrinsic transaction gas
EIP-8070 Sparse Blobpool

In particular, I think the impact of EIP-2780 should be understood early since it appears to have significant downstream consequences 
https://forkcast.org/eips/2780
even if the code change itself is simple.

author: lightclient
content:
<@194432762315407360> and I are proposing native account abstraction as the EL headliner for Hegota. We've been working with Vitalik to further generalize the previous native AA proposal EIP-7701 and have come up with the Frame Transaction. More here on the agenda: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1883#issuecomment-3815340368
EIP: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/11202/changes

author: jenpaff
content: Gm ! Some questions on [todays ACDE agenda ](https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1883) specifically on the Glamsterdam points:  Could you please elaborate what exactly will be discussed / what input is needed from client teams, which decisions we will need to make during the ACDE today? e.g. `devnet scoping` - is this just a general update or does this involve a decision that needs to be made?  If the latter: Could you write up what the decision is that we will need to make during the call and please link any pre-reading and context required.

author: qu0b
content: I think the devnet scoping point is about how we go about doing devnet scoping in the future <@892053833121923094> mentioned that we should improve the process here.

author: qu0b
content: Regarding devnets I think the agenda today is light and already discussed in ACDT, clients are working towards getting all of the EIPs <https://notes.ethereum.org/@ethpandaops/bal-devnet-2> implemented and ready for devnet-2, which we will hopefully be able to launch next Wednesday

author: ansgar.eth
content:
yes, today's agenda is light on decisions, given most Glamsterdam decisions are now either locked in, or in scope of ACDT.

main decisions I think will be on EIPs 7610, 7872, 7949 (PFI'd, non-protocol), as well as (potentially) on which BAL optimization will be in scope for the fork, and how to sequence them for upcoming devnets

author: ansgar.eth
content:
separately, clarification on headliners, because it came up several times:

the communication was "Proposals must be submitted by the February 4th deadline and presented at an All Core Devs call".

Feb 4 here is only the deadline for the written proposal, not the acd presentation. So today is **not** the last opportunity to present EL-side H* headliners. As long as they are propsed in time, they can still be presented at a later call (naturally the one in 2 weeks).

author: ansgar.eth
content:
updated the agenda for the call with a bit more details: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1883

see you all in 40min!

author: chfast
content: About EIP-7610: not hash collision (80bits) but preimage attack (160bits).
